com.apaulin.nso_controller

Class NSOController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.apaulin.nso_controller.NSOController

  • public class NSOController
extends java.lang.Object
    Controller of the NSO request. This is basically an abstraction layer for the requests object with an extra control.
    Since:
    22/07/2018
    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Anthony Paulin

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String ROBOT_LIBRARY_SCOPE 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      NSOController()
      Default constructor - Should be used only by robot framework when called as a test library.
      NSOController(java.lang.String address, java.lang.String user, java.lang.String password)
      Initialize the connection Example: NSOController nso = new NSOController("http://127.0.0.1:8080","admin","admin");
      NSOController(java.lang.String address, java.lang.String user, java.lang.String password, int id)
      Build the NSO Controller access Example: NSOController nso = new NSOController("http://127.0.0.1:8080","admin","admin",5); selecting an ID can be used if you want to manage your own IDs, for example if you use a multi-threads process.

      boolean deviceCheckSync(java.lang.String device)
      Check the device synchronization Return true on any case.

      Run a dry run using the CLI (Default on NSO) option Prefer dry run native for JSON, because CLI will return a String using + - and is difficult to process.

    • Constructor Detail

      • NSOController

        public NSOController()
        Default constructor - Should be used only by robot framework when called as a test library. If you call it as a Java library, you should call NSOController(String address, String user, String password,(int id)) For Robot framework, you must call the method init(String address, String user, String password)

      • NSOController

        public NSOController(java.lang.String address,
                     java.lang.String user,
                     java.lang.String password)
              throws NSOException
        Initialize the connection Example: NSOController nso = new NSOController("http://127.0.0.1:8080","admin","admin");
        Parameters:
        address - - Format http(s)://IP:PORT
        user - - username for the NSO connection
        password - - password for the NSO connection
        Throws:
        NSOException - NSO related exception

      • NSOController

        public NSOController(java.lang.String address,
                     java.lang.String user,
                     java.lang.String password,
                     int id)
              throws NSOException
        Build the NSO Controller access Example: NSOController nso = new NSOController("http://127.0.0.1:8080","admin","admin",5); selecting an ID can be used if you want to manage your own IDs, for example if you use a multi-threads process.
        Parameters:
        address - - Format http(s)://IP:PORT
        user - - username for the NSO connection
        password - - password for the NSO connection
        id - - The ID is used by RPC. But default it is a random integer generated by the library.
        Throws:
        NSOException - NSO related exception

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init(java.lang.String address,
                 java.lang.String user,
                 java.lang.String password)
          throws NSOException
        Initialize the connection This should only be used by robot framework to init a new object. For java, you should used the constructor NSOController(String address, String user, String password)
        Parameters:
        address - - Format http(s)://IP:PORT
        user - - username for the NSO connection
        password - - password for the NSO connection
        Throws:
        NSOException - NSO related exception if there is a NSO connection exception

      • restHead

        public java.lang.String restHead(java.lang.String path)
                          throws HTTPException,
                                 NSOException
        Get the HEAD value of the equivalent of a GET request. Default value = "application/vnd.yang.collection+json" Can be use to determine the header required for GET Example : String result = nso.restHead("/config/aaa");
        Parameters:
        path - Path to the leaf
        Returns:
        THe header as a String Ex: "Content-Type: text/json"
        Throws:
        NSOException - NSO related exception - for NSO related exception
        HTTPException - HTTP related exception

      • restHead

        public java.lang.String restHead(java.lang.String path,
                                 java.lang.String request)
                          throws HTTPException,
                                 NSOException
        Get the HEAD value of the equivalent of a GET request. Can be use to determine the header required for GET Example : String result = nso.restHead("/config/aaa","application/vnd.yang.collection+xml");
        Parameters:
        path - Path to the leaf
        request - The request format
        Returns:
        THe header as a String Ex: "Content-Type: text/xml"
        Throws:
        NSOException - - NSO related exception
        HTTPException - HTTP related exception

                                java.lang.String header)
                         throws HTTPException,
                                NSOException

      • validateCommit

        public java.lang.String validateCommit()
                                throws RPCException,
                                       NSOException
        Validate the commit for the current transaction This will explicitely valide the commit before running it. Example : nso.validateCommit(); nso.commitDryRunNative(); nso.validateCommit(); nso.commit();
        Returns:
        JSON result of the commit validation
        Throws:
        RPCException - RPC related exception
        NSOException - NSO related exception for NSO related exception

      • commit

        public java.lang.String commit(int timeout)
                        throws RPCException,
                               NSOException
        Commit the transaction If the commit validation has not been done before, this will run a commit validation. Example : nso.commit(); is equivalent to nso.validateCommmit(); nso.commit();
        Parameters:
        timeout - / If set to zero, need to confirm the commit
        Returns:
        The JSON Result form the commit
        Throws:
        RPCException - RPC related exception
        NSOException - for NSO related exception

      • commit

        public java.lang.String commit()
                        throws RPCException,
                               NSOException
        Commit the transaction If the commit validation has not been done before, this will run a commit validation. Example : nso.commit(); is equivalent to nso.validateCommmit(); nso.commit(); The default timeout is 600.
        Returns:
        The commit result
        Throws:
        RPCException - RPC related exception
        NSOException - for NSO related exception

      • commitDryRunNative

        public java.lang.String commitDryRunNative(int timeout)
                                    throws RPCException,
                                           NSOException
        Commit dry run using the native format Example : nso.commitDryRunNative(); This is equivalent of doing : nso.validateCommit(); nso.commitDryRunNative();
        Parameters:
        timeout - Set it to zero for version higher 4.7.X
        Returns:
        The command that the device will run
        Throws:
        RPCException - RPC related exception
        NSOException - for NSO related exception

      • dryRun

        public java.lang.String dryRun(int timeout)
                        throws RPCException,
                               NSOException
        Run a dry run using the CLI (Default on NSO) option Prefer dry run native for JSON, because CLI will return a String using + - and is difficult to process.
        Parameters:
        timeout - the timeout in ms
        Returns:
        commit dry run in json (default)
        Throws:
        NSOException - for NSO related exception
        RPCException - RPC related exception

      • dryRun

        public java.lang.String dryRun()
                        throws RPCException,
                               NSOException
        Run a dry run using the CLI (Default on NSO) option Prefer dry run native for JSON, because CLI will return a String using + - and is difficult to process. Default timeout 600
        Returns:
        commit dry run (600ms default)
        Throws:
        NSOException - for NSO related exception
        RPCException - RPC related exception

        NSOException - NSO related exception
